column1: Keyword Lists - Attached Keyword List indicator not working
column27:
Each keyword list has the potential to be attached to a query. From the keyword list, you should be able to see this and to see which queries are attached.

* The attached keyword list indicator when clicked leads to a blank page.
* The attached keyword list indicator does not have a hover state showing the attached keywords.

The indicator if click should lock the hover state open, if it does anything.

column1: Wrong placeholder on the tag modal
column27:
When the user type or role is read-only (role when the user is on a case or a team), the placeholder on the tag modal textbox is wrong.

This applies to new react list pages. 

Precondition:

user is read-only

at least one live query has been shared with the user. 

+Steps:+

1- Log in to Navigator with a read-only user.

2- Go to the live queries list page.

3- Click on the tag button.

+Actual result:+

Tag modal is displayed

The placeholder text for the tag modal textbox is wrong.

!image-20240806-203001.png|width=795,height=473,alt="image-20240806-203001.png"!

+Expected result:+

Placeholder text is correct. 

!image-20240806-203407.png|width=795,height=473,alt="image-20240806-203407.png"!

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
This issue is reproducible in all new react list pages when the logged user type or role is read-only.
{panel}

column1: [QB] Geofence + Keywords - Validate on secondary terms not displaying
column27:
When creating a Geofence + Keywords query, validation and blocking of the save button is not working properly. 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* If no secondary terms exist and the customer does not have broad collection enabled, the save button should not be active if secondary terms are not used in a Geofence + Keywords query

*Testing Criteria:*

* Create a Geofence + keyword query and attempt to save it when no secondary terms are present but broad collection for the org is disabled.

column1: [QB] Query Builder Modals - Use Enter key to accept prompts
column27:
We have many modals in navigator. It would be convenient if we could use the enter key to accept and escape to cancel.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* The enter key confirms a modal dialogue.
* The escape key cancels a modal dialogue.
* Depending on scope, limit this to Query Builder confirmation dialogues only, not all modals.

*Testing Criteria:*

*

column27:
A request has been made to add a sort button to the keyword group list in the new Query Builder. This will allow users to sort keywords as they see fit.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* A sort button is visible next to the ‘Clear All’ button.
* Sorting ensures any entered keywords are sorted alphabetically.
* Translations should be kept grouped with their parent keyword.

*Testing Criteria:*

* Insert keywords (including translations and similar terms) and use the sort button to order the inserted keywords alphabetically.

column1: [QB] Block leave page only if data has changed
column27:
Currently, {{useBlocker}} prompts the user about leaving the page if the title is not empty. This can be improved by checking if data has changed rather than what is currently is implemented.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Prompt the user about leaving the page only if the data has changed since arriving on the page.
* Can start with only title. Keep in mind keywords and other query data points.

column1: [KWL] Disable Actions for curated keyword lists
column27:
Curated keywords should not be editable or delete-able by a non-curated keyword manager. Additionally, they should not be shareable in general.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Curated keywords should not be editable or delete-able if the user is not a curated keyword manager
* Curated keywords should not be share-able or copy-able to teams.

column1: [QB] Geofence adjust map zoom when resizing circle or square selectors
column27:
When adjusting the size of the Geofence circle and square selectors, the map should zoom in and out to accommodate the new selector size.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Decreasing the size of the circle selector zooms the map in.
* Increasing the size of the circle selector zooms the map out.
* Same behavior for the square selector.
